question:
Which was the first programmable general purpose computer in the world?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The ENIAC (Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer) was the first programmable general-purpose electronic digital computer in the world.
  • It was developed in the United States in 1945 by John Mauchly and J. Presper Eckert.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (c) ENIAC.

Additional Information:

  • Pascaline: Invented by Blaise Pascal in the 1640s, it was a mechanical calculator – not programmable or electronic.
  • Napier’s Bones: Invented by John Napier in the early 1600s to simplify multiplication and division – manual tool, not a computer.
  • Mark I: An electromechanical computer developed by IBM and Harvard in 1944, programmable but not fully electronic like ENIAC.
  • ENIAC was the first machine that could be programmed to perform a wide variety of tasks using electronic circuits.

question:
Preet wants to use object oriented programming language for her application. Which among the following languages should she pick?

RRB JE 14/12/2014
option_1: Either Java or Pascal
solution:
• Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) is a programming paradigm based on the concept of “objects”, which contain data and code to manipulate that data.
  • Java is a fully object-oriented programming language designed with OOP principles like encapsulation, inheritance, and polymorphism.
  • Pascal and BASIC are primarily procedural languages, not object-oriented by default.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (b) Java.

Additional Information:

  • Java supports core OOP features: classes, objects, abstraction, inheritance, encapsulation, and polymorphism.
  • Pascal has an extension called Object Pascal, but standard Pascal is not object-oriented.
  • BASIC is a beginner-level language used for procedural programming and lacks full OOP support.
  • Java is widely used for building desktop, web, and mobile applications, especially Android apps.

question:
C++ is an example of which type of computer language?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
option_3: String and List Processing
solution:
• C++ is a powerful Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) language, developed as an extension of the C language.
  • It supports OOP principles such as encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, and abstraction, allowing modular and reusable code.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (d) Object-Oriented Language.

Additional Information:

  • C++ can also support procedural programming, making it a multi-paradigm language, but its key strength lies in its object-oriented capabilities.
  • It is widely used for developing system software, games, real-time simulations, and high-performance applications.
  • Unlike Visual Programming Languages (e.g., Scratch), C++ is text-based and code-driven.

question:
The instruction that is not to be executed immediately is placed in the ___________ .

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The Instruction Buffer Register (IBR) is used to store instructions that are fetched but not yet ready to be executed immediately.
  • This mechanism allows the CPU to hold part of the instruction temporarily when working with faster instruction pipelines.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (d) Instruction Buffer Register (IBR).

Additional Information:

  • Program Counter (PC): Holds the address of the next instruction to be fetched from memory.
  • Current Instruction Register (CIR): Holds the instruction currently being executed.
  • Memory Address Register (MAR): Stores the address of the memory location to be accessed (for reading/writing).
  • Instruction Buffer Register (IBR) is specifically used to temporarily store the second part of a fetched instruction when the instruction is split.

question:
________ memory is sometimes used to increase the speed of processing by making current programs and data available to the CPU at a rapid rate.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Cache memory is a small, high-speed memory located close to or inside the CPU.
  • It is used to store frequently accessed data and instructions so that the CPU can retrieve them faster than from main memory (RAM).
  • This significantly increases the processing speed and reduces latency.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (d) Cache.

Additional Information:

  • Backup memory refers to external storage used for long-term data safety (e.g., external hard drives).
  • Main memory (RAM) is used for running programs but is slower than cache.
  • Auxiliary memory (like hard disks, SSDs) is used for large, long-term storage and is even slower than RAM.
  • Cache memory acts as a bridge between CPU and RAM, improving system performance.

question:
________ server acts as a set of components accessible to the software developer through an API defined by the platform itself.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• An Application Server provides software components and services to application developers via a well-defined API (Application Programming Interface).
  • It enables the business logic of applications to run on the server-side, allowing clients to access services remotely.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (c) Application.

Additional Information:

  • Database server: Manages and provides access to databases.
  • Mail server: Handles the sending and receiving of emails.
  • FTP server: Facilitates file transfer over a network using File Transfer Protocol.
  • Application server supports functions like transaction management, messaging, security, and load balancing for running complex applications.

question:
Web Page Written in which language.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A web page is primarily written using HTML (HyperText Markup Language).
  • HTML provides the structure and content layout of a web page, including text, headings, images, links, and forms.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (d) HTML.

Additional Information:

  • C/C++: General-purpose programming languages, mainly used for software and system development — not for web pages.
  • FORTRAN: One of the oldest programming languages, used for scientific computing — not related to web development.
  • SQL (Structured Query Language): Used for managing and querying databases, not for designing web page structure.
  • HTML is the foundation language of the World Wide Web and is supported by all web browsers.

question:
What is logo in computer?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• LOGO is a programming language primarily used for educational purposes, especially to introduce children to programming concepts.
  • It is well known for its “turtle graphics”, where commands move a turtle on the screen to draw shapes and patterns.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (b) Programming Language.

Additional Information:

  • LOGO was developed in the 1960s by Seymour Papert and others as a way to teach thinking and problem-solving through coding.
  • It uses simple commands like FORWARD, BACK, LEFT, and RIGHT to move the turtle.
  • LOGO helps students learn programming logic, loops, and procedures in a visual and interactive way.

question:
Which of the following is not a high-level language?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 09/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Machine Language is the lowest-level programming language, consisting of binary code (0s and 1s) directly understood by the computer's CPU.
  • It is not a high-level language because it lacks readability, abstraction, and is hardware-specific.
  • Java, C, and C++ are all high-level languages designed to be more understandable and user-friendly for programmers.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option (d) Machine Language.

Additional Information:

  • High-level languages are portable, easier to debug, and closer to human language.
  • Programs written in high-level languages need to be compiled or interpreted into machine language before execution.
  • Machine language is processor-specific, making it difficult to use across platforms.

question:
In which generation of computers were FORTRAN and COBOL languages first used?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 08/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• FORTRAN (Formula Translation) and COBOL (Common Business Oriented Language) were among the first high-level programming languages.
  • They were developed and first used during the Second Generation of computers, which used transistors instead of vacuum tubes.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option (a) II Generation.

Additional Information:

  • First Generation (1940s–1956): Used vacuum tubes; programming was done in machine language.
  • Second Generation (1956–1963): Used transistors; introduced high-level languages like FORTRAN (1957) and COBOL (1959).
  • Third Generation: Introduced integrated circuits and more advanced languages.
  • Fourth Generation: Used microprocessors.
  • Fifth Generation: Focused on artificial intelligence and advanced computing.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a spreadsheet program?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Ubuntu is not a spreadsheet program; it is a Linux-based operating system.
  • Calc (LibreOffice Calc), Excel (Microsoft Excel), and VisiCalc are all spreadsheet software used for performing calculations, data analysis, and charting.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option (a) Ubuntu.

Additional Information:

  • Ubuntu is an open-source OS based on Debian Linux, used for personal and professional computing.
  • Calc is the spreadsheet component of the LibreOffice suite.
  • Excel is part of the Microsoft Office suite, one of the most widely used spreadsheet applications.
  • VisiCalc was the first spreadsheet software, released in 1979, considered the program that helped launch the personal computing revolution.

question:
What is the full form of FORTRAN?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 11/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The full form of FORTRAN is Formula Translation.
  • It was one of the earliest high-level programming languages, developed in the 1950s by IBM.
  • FORTRAN was specifically designed for scientific and engineering computations, where mathematical formulas needed to be translated into machine code.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option (c) Formula Translation.

Additional Information:

  • FORTRAN allowed users to write code using mathematical expressions that resembled real-world formulas.
  • It introduced concepts like loops, conditionals, and subroutines, which became standard in later programming languages.
  • FORTRAN is still used in scientific computing, particularly in fields like physics, numerical analysis, and aerospace.

question:
________ is a high-level programming language for scientific and mathematical use-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 03/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Correct Answer:(d) FORTRAN
  • Definition:FORTRAN stands for Formula Translation and is designed for scientific, engineering, and mathematical computations.
  • Purpose: It excels at numerical analysis, complex calculations, and large-scale numerical simulations.

Additional Information:

  • Origin: Developed by IBM in the 1950s, making it one of the oldest high‑level languages still in use.
  • Applications: Widely used in weather forecasting, computational physics, chemistry simulations, and numerical linear algebra.
  • Contrast:
    • COBOL is for business applications.
    • EDP (Electronic Data Processing) is a process, not a language.
    • RFID is a tracking technology, not a programming language.

question:
FORTRAN is the ____________ .

RRB NTPC Stage-I 05/02/2021 (Shift-I)

RRB NTPC Stage-I 08/01/2021 (Shift-I)
option_1: Language of the fifth generation computers
option_2: First high level programming language
option_3: First electronic digital computer of the world
option_4: Link to connect all the universities
solution:
• Correct Answer:(b) First high-level programming language
  • Description:FORTRAN was developed as the first high‑level language tailored for scientific and engineering computations.

Additional Information:

  • Development: Created by IBM in 1957, introducing an English-like syntax that abstracted away machine code.
  • Impact: Paved the way for subsequent languages such as ALGOL and C, and remains in use for legacy scientific applications.

question:
Programming language Java was developed by __________.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 04/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Correct Answer:(d) James Gosling
  • Creator:James Gosling led the development team at Sun Microsystems.
  • Design Goals: Java was designed for platform independence, object‑oriented programming, and network computing.

Additional Information:

  • Initial Name: Originally called Oak, renamed Java in 1995.
  • Release: First publicly released in 1995 and swiftly adopted for web applets.
  • Impact: Became one of the most popular languages for enterprise and mobile (Android) development.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a computer programming language?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 22/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Correct Answer:(c) C++++
  • Reason:C++++ is not a recognised programming language; the actual language is C++.
  • Other Options:Python, Java, and Swift are all established programming languages.

Additional Information:

  • C++ was created by Bjarne Stroustrup as an extension of the C language.
  • Swift was introduced by Apple in 2014 for iOS/macOS app development.
  • Python and Java are widely used in web, scientific, and enterprise software.

question:
What is the official name of JavaScript?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 17/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Official Name:ECMAScript
  • Standardization: Standardized by ECMA International in 1997
  • Relation:JavaScript is the primary implementation of the ECMAScript standard

Additional Information:

  • Versions: Updated through editions like ES6, ES2015, etc.
  • Specification: Defines a clear specification for scripting languages
  • Browser Support: All modern browsers adhere to the ECMAScript standard to ensure compatibility

question:
What is the full form of COBOL?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/02/2021 (Shift-II)

RRB NTPC Stage-I 08/01/2021 (Shift-I)

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/01/2021 (Shift-II)
option_1: Common Open Business Objective Language
option_2: Computer Operative Business Oriented Language
option_4: Computer Operative Business Objective Language
solution:
• Common Business-Oriented Language is the full form of COBOL.
  • It is a high‑level programming language designed for business data processing.
  • The specification was developed in 1959 by a committee led by Grace Hopper.

Additional Information:

  • COBOL was created to improve portability of code across different machines.
  • It uses an English‑like syntax that makes programs self‑documenting.
  • Many legacy financial and administrative systems still run on COBOL.

question:
A computer program that converts an entire program into machine language is called a/an:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 21/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Compiler is a program that converts the entire source code into machine code before execution.
  • It produces an executable file which can be run multiple times without re‑compilation.
  • It performs syntax analysis, optimization, and code generation.

Additional Information:

  • Interpreters convert code line-by-line, whereas compilers translate the whole program at once.
  • Compiled programs generally have faster execution compared to interpreted ones.
  • Popular compilers include GCC, Clang, and Microsoft Visual C++.

question:
The C++ programming language was developed at AT & T Bell Laboratories in the early _________ by Bjarne Stroustrup.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 13/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• In the early 1980s, Bjarne Stroustrup developed C++ at AT & T Bell Laboratories.
  • It was originally called “C with Classes”.
  • He added object‑oriented programming features to the C language.

Additional Information:

  • The work took place in Murray Hill, New Jersey.
  • The first commercial release of C++ arrived in 1985.
  • By the late 1980s, C++ compilers were widely available.

question:
The _________ is a simple query language used for accessing handling and _________ data in a relation database.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 13/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• SQL is a simple query language used for accessing, handling, and manipulating data in a relational database.
  • It allows users to retrieve and modify data using declarative statements.
  • SQL commands are classified into DML, DDL, DCL, and TCL categories.

Additional Information:

  • DML (Data Manipulation Language) includes SQL commands like SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE.
  • DDL (Data Definition Language) includes CREATE, ALTER, and DROP statements for database schema.
  • SQL follows the ANSI and ISO standards for relational databases.

question:
ASCII is a code to denote the English alphabets in numeric’s. Its full form is _________.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/12/2020 (Shift-II)
option_1: Australian Secure Code for Information Interchange
option_2: American Standard Code for Information Interchange
option_3: American Secure Code for Information Interchange
option_4: Australian Standard Code for Information Interchange
solution:
• American Standard Code for Information Interchange is the full form of ASCII.
  • It encodes 128 characters, including letters, digits, and control characters.
  • It uses a 7‑bit binary number to represent each character.

Additional Information:

  • ASCII was first published in 1963 by the ANSI committee.
  • Extended ASCII uses 8 bits, allowing up to 256 symbols.
  • ASCII underpins text representation in nearly all modern computer systems.

question:
Python is a ___________.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/12/2020 (Shift-II)

RRB NTPC Stage-I 17/01/2017 (Shift-III)
solution:
• Python is a programming language.
  • It is an interpreted, high‑level language with dynamic typing.
  • Developed by Guido van Rossum and first released in 1991.

Additional Information:

  • Python supports multiple programming paradigms, including object‑oriented and functional.
  • It has a large standard library and a flourishing third‑party ecosystem (PyPI).
  • Widely used for web development, data analysis, machine learning, and automation.

question:
Who is credited with developing “C” language?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 20/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Dennis Ritchie is credited with developing the C language.
  • He designed it at Bell Labs between 1969 and 1973.
  • C provided low‑level access, efficiency, and portability.

Additional Information:

  • C influenced many languages like C++, C#, and Java.
  • The K&R C book by Kernighan and Ritchie was published in 1978.
  • C remains widely used in systems programming and embedded systems.

question:
Which is the official language for development of android?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 16/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Java is the official language for Android development.
  • It is object‑oriented and platform‑independent, enabling write‑once‑run‑anywhere.
  • Google officially supports Java for its SDK and APIs.

Additional Information:

  • Since 2017, Kotlin has also been introduced as an officially supported language.
  • Android apps run on the Android Runtime (ART) for better performance.
  • Android Studio is the official IDE, with built‑in Java support.

question:
Which of the following is not a member of the group of programming languages?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 05/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• POP3 is not a programming language; it is a protocol for retrieving email.
  • Assembly language, C++, and Java are all programming languages.
  • POP3 stands for Post Office Protocol version3 and is used by email clients.

Additional Information:

  • Programming languages allow developers to write software instructions executed by computers.
  • Assembly language is a low-level programming language close to machine code.
  • C++ and Java are high-level, object-oriented languages widely used in software development.

question:
Which of the following is a graphical representation of the algorithm?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Flowchart is a graphical representation of an algorithm.
  • It uses standard symbols such as rectangles for processes and diamonds for decisions.
  • Helps in visualizing program logic before actual coding.

Additional Information:

  • Flowcharts improve communication by making complex logic easy to understand.
  • They simplify debugging by clearly mapping the flow of control.
  • Can be readily converted into pseudo code or actual source code.

question:
Which of the following is not an operating system?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Scala is not an operating system; it is a programming language.
  • Android, UNIX, and Windows are all operating systems.
  • Operating systems manage hardware resources and provide services to applications.

Additional Information:

  • Scala runs on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM), not directly on hardware.
  • Android is built on the Linux kernel with additional frameworks.
  • UNIX has influenced many modern OSes, including macOS and Linux.

question:
Debugging is-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/03/2016 (Shift-III)
option_1: The process of rolling out a software program
option_2: The process of modifying a software program
option_3: The process of finding the error in a software program
option_4: The process of changing the design structure of a program
solution:
• Debugging is the process of finding and removing errors (bugs) in a software program.
  • It involves using debuggers to inspect program state and execution flow.
  • Effective debugging improves software reliability and performance.

Additional Information:

  • Debugging techniques include breakpoints, step execution, and logging statements.
  • Common bug types are logic errors, syntax errors, and runtime errors.
  • Continuous debugging and testing are integral to Agile and DevOps workflows.

question:
Which of the following logical relation operation C means ‘not equal to’?

RRB SSE 21/12/2014
solution:
• != is the not equal to operator in C.
  • It compares two operands and yields true if they are different.
  • It’s a relational operator commonly used in conditional statements.

Additional Information:

  • == is the equality operator, the counterpart to !=.
  • Other C relational operators include <, <=, >, and >=.
  • Using != in if statements and loops helps control program flow based on inequality.
